Name: Bridal Veil Falls
Description: A pretty waterfall that gently cascades down the valley, don't forget to take a few snapshots as you walk past on the track.

Name: Harris Saddle
Description: The long climb to the Harris Saddle, the highest point of the track, is worth every step. The saddle has pretty little tarns (mountain lakes) hidden in its folds.

Name: lake Harris
Description: A hidden delight! The track sidles past this beautiful deep blue mountain lake, tucked into the surrounding mountains and alpine valley.

Name: Routeburn Falls
Description: Enjoy the dramatic landscape around the Falls, before descending to the alpine meadows of the Routeburn Flats.

Name: The Big Slip'
Description: 'The Big Slip' happened in 1997 and cleared the beech forest from around the track affording views back down the Routeburn as well as up the Routeburn (north branch) towards Mt. Somnus (2293 metres) and Mt Momus (2148 metres).

Name: Hollyford Valley
Description: Look over the Hollyford Valley to the ice capped Darran Mountains before descending to lake Mackenzie.

Name: yellowhead/mohua
Description: Spot the endangered yellowhead/mohua. This cute little songster is often perched high in the treetops. Listen out for its distinctive chirpy song along the first 3 kms of the track.

Name: Conical Hill
Description: Take the popular side trip to Conical Hill (1515m) and you'll be rewarded with spectacular views on a good day of the Hollyford Valley through to lake McKerrow, Martins Bay and the Tasman Sea.

Name: Harris Saddle Shelter
Description: From the Harris shelter, you are surrounded by mountains. Follow the well-trodden path from the shelter heading up to Conical Hill (1515m) to enjoy 360ï¿½ panoramic views.
